page.title: 06PARK FARM
page.content: Park Farm is just outside Bodiam, spanning the A229.The farm has been in the Bailey family for two generations. The farm has 550 acres of land including 100 acres of woods. This land is mainly used for grazing cattle; and wheat and oil seed rape are grown. Grass is used for making forage and hay during the summer for feeding the cows in the winter. Mr Bailey employs four farm hands who help run the farm. The machinery used includes tractors, ploughs, a hay-baler, trailers and a combine harvester. The cows are milked in a mechanized parlour. Wheat, oil seed rape and 650,000 litres of milk per year are sold. Since 1981 the family has lived in a converted oast and also run a popular camp site on a small area of the farm.
